website_summaries.verdict: An exceptionally popular option for customers wanting a reliable 3D filament with a sleek color.
pros: Designed universally for 3D printers using a 1.75mm filament
Printing and quality of filament remains consistent after multiple uses
cons: Company appears to have poor customer service
Filament is wound messily around spool

customer_reviews.title: Item delivered was not the item described
customer_reviews.text: I paid a premium price for what I thought would be high quality PLA. The item description says the PLA dimension is 1.75mm within .03mm, plus or minus. However, the item delivered is clearly marked as 1.75mm within .05mm, plus or minus (see photo). Higher tolerance PLA is less expensive. I feel that this is either a very serious mistake with the stocking or a very underhanded ploy to make money. Either way, the item delivered was not the item described. If you choose to order this product, read the labels carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Ausley

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: This used to be my go to brand of PLA filament. My first spool of black filament was perfect, zero issues with it. My second one, not so much. It was extremely brittle and completely unusable. Hatchbox replaced it free of charge. Of course by the time I got the replacement, I had already switched to another brand. A few months ago, I opened up the replacement roll (still vacuum sealed!) and it seemed just fine. Unfortunately, after a few hours of printing, this one turned out to be super brittle as well. I'm absolutely done with Hatchbox. Do yourself the favor and spend a little more on premium, US manufactured filament.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Perez

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this stuff because when it's running it does do ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this stuff because when it's running it does do quality prints. The problem is if you go 3 days without printing it's like the brittle nature of this ensures it's going to snap off at the base or in the feed tube or anywhere there is a mild amount of stress. Every single time I use HATCHBOX I have to refeed it into the headed printhead to make sure I have a consistent line of PLA, otherwise I find it has broken somewhere in the middle and it kills my print.
customer_reviews.author: Syl Cat

customer_reviews.title: There's No Store Where I can get this Quicker.
customer_reviews.text: HATCHBOX PLA 3D Printer Filament, Dimensional Accuracy +/- 0.03 mm, 1 kg Spool, 1.75 mm, Black - What can I say? This stuff just works. Never had an issue with it. I have a MonoPrice Select Mini V3 and this was the filament recommended to me by a friend. I have done quite a bit of experimenting with this and the part that still amazes me is the ability of the printer and this filament to print reliably in mid-air over spans of several inches. No complaints. Had it in my hands within 24 hours of ordering through Prime. BONUS! Seriously, I was just checking to see what day it would arrive and discovered that it already on my door-step.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Excellent consistency in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is the most reliably consistent in this price range compared to other PLA's I've tested. I've so far had no issues with the several spools I've gone through on a CR10. When I want a print with little to no finishing without spending a fortune, this is the stuff I go for. Only few gripes I have is that even the cheaper filaments have better designed spools and extras. For instance the spool has no indication of how much filament is left, They should take a cue from their competitors and just add in a few holes or cut a line down the side of the spool to show how much is left.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Decent Enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm still new to 3D printing so don't have a great amount of insight so far on how the quality relates to other brands. However, so far I've had good results with this material. It was packaged well, easy to handle for installing, and the price seems good for the volume of material. I ordered 2 other brands getting half to a 3rd less material for the same price. Only problems I've had so far were related to the printer itself and the settings used.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: BLACK WILL NOT STICK
customer_reviews.text: Note, this review only applies to the color black. It does not apply to Hatchbox True Black or their other colors. Perhaps this was from a bad batch, but after several failed prints I ended up discarding this roll. Even during bed level calibration tests, this filament simply would not stick to the glass based on my Ender 3. Where as if I switched to a different color it worked perfectly. I contacted support and after I provided photos and such, they said I should try to return it to Amazon. However it was beyond the return window. I've tried another less expensive brand now with good results. Might be time to switch brands for all the colors.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great filament, double check your weight.
customer_reviews.text: First off this is great filament never once had a tangle from factory. The prints come out damn good exp. black shows all the little imperfections in the print. Also the actual empty spool weight is 251.1grams according to my scale. Online it states the weight at 220grams. That's a big discrepancy when your using weight to gauge how much is left in the spool. Tips: PLEASE MAKE MARKS ON THE SIDE OF THE SPOOL TO SHOW HOW MUCH IS LEFT IN WEIGHT AND LENGHT. THAT WAY PEOPLE WITH LOWER END MACHINES WITH NO THERMAL RUNAWAY OR FILAMENT RUN OUT SWITCHES CAN HAVE A PEICE OF MIND WHEN GETTING CLOSE TO THE END OF THE SPOOL.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: This filament isn't bad but twice now they've marked this as +/-
customer_reviews.text: This filament isn't bad but twice now they've marked this as +/-.03 when really they've sent +/-.05. this REALLY needs fixed. I hate how hatchbox continually sends the wrongly described item
customer_reviews.author: Yamionxtc

customer_reviews.title: I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: So far the Black has been my favorite as I did not have any problem with any of the prints after I got my setting dialed down. I was very impressed with the Black compared to the Roll that came with the printer. Bed adhesion is really good and did not get much shrinkage on the first few layers; so my corners did not lift off the bed. After printing their is a slight glossy finish to the black. Since it is so dark you do lose some of the finer details because they fad in.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Wound Filament
customer_reviews.text: Just as others have pointed out, the Hatchbox filament is wound poorly around the spool. It is almost as if they do not care. Not just one or two spots, but the whole spool. I should not have to worry about this and sit there watching my print. At least they are truthful in the photos they have posted in the description that shows this.
customer_reviews.author: BlackLabsMatter

customer_reviews.title: Drastic decrease in quality over the last year.
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing about 6 rolls of this color and branch every week for a year. This last time will likely be the final time. EVERY SINGLE roll (12) this purchase did not stick to my bed on any printer I tried it on. It even crashed my printer multiple times mid print for seemingly no reason. I'm not sure if they changed their manufacture or their formula but whatever it was it is BAAADDDD.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Fruge

customer_reviews.title: Filament is a tangled mess on the spool
customer_reviews.text: Hatchbox had been my mainstay filament for 4 years until this spool. I just used their light gray and loved it. This black PLA prints just fine, but I've been having to "un-overlap" the filament on the spool as the printer goes. Now, not even halfway through the roll, it has jammed up to a complete twisted mess. Unusable. I wasted 2 hours trying to get it untangled. Frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Greg - FL

customer_reviews.title: Spooled Unevenly!
customer_reviews.text: I've been 3D printing for a little over a year now with our Ender 3. Before that, I had a Monoprice Mini. I've never experienced a spool of PLA like Hatchbox. Hatchbox spool was spooled so unevenly that I could not print anything without having to stand by the printer constantly and untangle spool as it's feeding into our printer. Not sure why as I had a roll (of a different color) a few years ago and it was fine. Quality has definitely dropped and I cannot trust this Hatchbox PLA on longer prints. I'm shopping for a replacement spool of a different brand today!
customer_reviews.author: Good Bird

customer_reviews.title: The quality of tghe PLA is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Well, the very first roll of Hatchbox black PLA I ordered was excellent. The second and third roll of PLA has been different. One roll seemed not good quality of the first. On the third roll the filament keeps snapping while sitting on the printer. I find the third roll to be bad quality and the filament just isn't consistent. Now I'm hesitant to order anymore Hatchbox PLA due to the poor quality of the second and third roll. Its like roll of the dice with this brand PLA. 22 dollars to toss out when you get a bad roll isn't good, not sure why they cant keep a consistent quality?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First PLA ever, was great at first
customer_reviews.text: This was the first roll of filament I've ever printed with, being brand new to 3D printing and all. Didn't take long to get the settings right. Printing with 195C extruder and 60C bed. We'll see what happens the further into the spool I get. EDIT: June 6, 2019. Hit a big snag and ruined a print, right at 90% completion too. This spool was great but has steadily gotten worse the more I’ve used. The printer has been skipping layers due to inconsistent filament diameter, and I’ve had to manually unwind filament because it wasn’t wound great. I don’t know if I will buy from Hatchbox again if this becomes a common theme
customer_reviews.author: mOWWck

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Hatchbox PLA has been the most hassle-free and consistent PLA I have tired using; currently have their PLA in white, black, red, gray, and pink. I never have any issues with adhesion. Quality is fantastic, as long as your printer's assembled properly and temps aren't set too high. On my Ender 3, I get great results with nozzle/bed temps set to 195/50 C. I highly recommend this PLA, especially to all the novice printers out there; this PLA works great out of the box with default Cura settings, + or - nozzle/bed temp tweaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay filament
customer_reviews.text: Had some problems getting this filament to stick to the glass top of my ender 3 pro.... I tried just about everything in the reviews to get this filament to to work.... I ended up taking apart the pla end and I had a broken fan.... Since this problem I had to have the magnetic base and start the bed temp at 70 for the first layer and keep it at 65 for the rest of the print.... I would probably buy this again andake sure to use it up before the 30 return policy
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Hamand

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 spool on 6x print attempts wasted!
customer_reviews.text: This is really crap filament! I have tried using this on 6 prints, all of which have failed, and have wasted half the spool! It just will NOT adhere to anything for more than a 2 hour print. If I try the same print with a different brand....SUCCESS! I have tried a both hairspray and Elmer's purple glue stick on a glass bed, tried adjusting both the extruder and bed temps, have tried over and over to level the bed as accurately as I can, all without success. Again, as soon as I switch to another brand of PLA, it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Morris

customer_reviews.title: Black filament tolerance  is 0.05mm, not the advertised 0.03!
customer_reviews.text: Had very variable experience with Hatchbox. Most of the time, everything is working great and get some great prints out of it but lastly, I had a series of problems. Winding the spool was too tight or tangled, 2 spools of bad filaments that took me way too much time troubleshoot, filament clogging the feeder by releasing too much filament dust with a result of the feeder not gripping the filament anymore, ruining the print and clogging the extruder. Last but not least, I've realized that the tolerance advertised on amazon is not the size that is provided.
customer_reviews.author: Patient0x00

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome filiment for my Dremel printer
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of different filiment for my dremel 3d45 as the dremel brand is a bit expensive. After many failed attempts, I came across a few comments talking about this brand and how well it worked. I figured in would give it a show, and wow I'm so happy I did. It doesn't bubble or warp at all, and the adhesion to the class and build is simply awesome. Even when I set my printer to medium quality, my builds come out looking fantastic. This will now be my go to brand, and cant tell you enough how happy I am esp6for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tool Review Zone

customer_reviews.title: Poorly spooled looked used and rewound before even opening
customer_reviews.text: I naively assumed that those critical reviews were just unlucky customers coming here to vent. Well, that is definitely not the case. EVERY SINGLE PRINT on this spool screws up. The diameter of the pla is uneven, it breaks off in the feed tube when trying to swap it out, it sticks to the nozzle when it fails. This has been a complete disaster with this spool and has made a novice 3d printer user very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cagle

customer_reviews.title: Old PLA breaks multiple time while printing
customer_reviews.text: They must have had this PLA in storage somewhere for a long time, very brittle and didn't even make it through a full print without breaking while operating under normal conditions. Will not be buying this brand again, maybe it was the seller selling old stock who knows all i know is that the filament keeps breaking while processing.
customer_reviews.author: SeanM

customer_reviews.title: 2 Tangles before 300g now I have to respool it
customer_reviews.text: I am not very picky and I usually give good reviews, however having to spool 300g of filament about 100m due to tangles is a huge time waster. Having tangles was annoying, but a spool that is unusable after 60% usage is ridiculous. I now skip Hatchbox when I see them their guarantee is useless unless you are going to blow through a spool in 30 days. I have had the best luck with tty3d and Creality Filament. Printers Ender3 and A30M looking at getting another Ender3 and Ender 5.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Seems to behave differently to the Yellow and Orange colors from Hatchbox
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty printing this on one of my machines (Monoprice Maker Select V2) but it printed well on my new Prusa MK3s. This is a bit of a bummer as the Yellow and Orange Hatchbox filaments I had were not as temperamental. It seems I can now get good results with it on the Prusa with higher temperatures; it's unfortunate that I spent 17+ hours on a failed print and +200g of filament when I expected it to print well the first time like most Hatchbox filament does. I'll keep buying Hatchbox in the future, but I'm a bit concerned about whether or not the black prints differently, or if I just got an odd spool.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hamel-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good deep black
customer_reviews.text: Prints look lovely with filament. My only gripe is that when I switch out to another color, it takes forever to purge out all of the black. Though what can you expect. It's black. Of course it will be difficult to purge. The black is very deep. No faded looking color. It kinda resembles the few parts I spray painted black, before I got this filament, which is a bit impressive. This is my second roll of hatchbox filament (my other roll being orange) and both look very nice. I'll probably stick with this brand for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Caige Spade

customer_reviews.title: My go-to filament
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of different PLA filament, but this one is definitely my trusty standby. Where I sometimes have to use hairspray or other tricks to get other filaments to adhere well (least I come back to the dreaded spaghetti monster), Hatchbox black sticks well every time without fuss. I print a lot of monsters and scenery for D&D and never have issues with getting the details right. Granted, your settings and temp do matter (this one seems to like about 205 degrees in my experience), but if you are willing to dial everything in right you'll get nice prints.
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Just couldn't get very good print quality
customer_reviews.text: I tried every setting I could think of, things that worked great for EVERY other filament. I tried high temps, low temps, cooling, no cooling... Now I'm just trying to find whatever I can to finish this reel on that doesn't matter if it's a crappy print. Suffice to say, I'll be looking at other brands for PLA from now on. Too bad, I've had really good luck with their ABS.
customer_reviews.author: gearhead

customer_reviews.title: First 3/4 of roll was Great rest was Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Just got two rolls about two Weeks ago. First 3/4 of both rolls worked great. Last quarter spool on both spools was unusable. Very brittle and kept breaking. Not sure if I will try another roll or not. Print Quality is great when it will print. Spools were only two weeks old. Value for money was not that great as only 3/4 of the spool was usable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim King

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Spool Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my third spool of hatchbox PLA. The first two were great but this one is awful! It was wound very poorly and keeps getting stuck so I come back to air printing. I have to check every 15 minutes or so to help it along unless I want a completely botched print job. It's very frustrating. I am hoping it's just bad luck but I am a little hesitant to try hatchbox again after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The first spool I got was ok. The print quality wasn't super but it was ok and I didn't have any issues. However, the second spool I got had MANY tangles in the winding of the spool. As a result, I am not able to print much of anything without having to be near the printer and constantly keep an eye on it in the event that it snags AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but brittle under certain circumstances
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but for a single annoying flaw. I generally leave it loaded and ready to go. If I don't print with it OFTEN, I find that the filament breaks in the guiding tube, so if I don't catch it, it prints nothing when it gets to the break and when I do catch it, I have to fish/push the broken pieces of filament out. The only brittle parts seem to be those in the guide tube. I otherwise get pretty good prints from it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moran

customer_reviews.title: Too brittle...
customer_reviews.text: Layers well and looks good but would keeps breaking during a project and ruins it. It's very brittle you can slightly bend it and it breaks. It came out of a vacuum sealed package so moisture/exposure was not the culprit. It is not fun having to keep disassembling the extruded to remove the broken line after finding out your print was ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Great PLA for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I honestly was just getting into 3D printing, and didn't want to spend a small fortune for filament. I ended up buying this, and honestly in the beginning, I didn't exactly like this stuff. So, after fiddling with it for a bit, I realized that with my Monoprice Maker Select plus, it likes 210-215 degrees of hot end, and the printer bed to be 55-60. I usually just spray some hairspray or honestly just some blue painters tape makes this stuff stick pretty well. So, if you're wondering if this is good or not, it is. Don't be put off by the price. It's worth it, if you ask me...
customer_reviews.author: Romeo Delshad

customer_reviews.title: 29 hours into a print and it locked up and caused a print failure
customer_reviews.text: I am currently watching youtube videos on how to recover from a failed print. For about half of the spool the filament was great, but 29 hours into a 52 hour print and it started to bind up on the spool. I thought I had freed it up, but it was too late. Several layers were now missing and the print started to turn to spaghetti.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fountain

customer_reviews.title: Filament winding on spool sloppy first aproximate 100 grams of use
customer_reviews.text: first hundred grams filament winding was pretty loose and sloppy I think something was wrong with their winder at the end of the winding process. Normally Hatchbox is a very good supplier. Did not return though i had a bad print due to this. No other problems and completed the spool. If it happens again on another order i will drop the company
customer_reviews.author: burnt thumbs

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: FAULTY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was the only prime eligible filament in early April 2020 due to the coronavirus outbreak limiting shipping options/suspension of FBA. Do NOT trust this filament. Works well when it prints, however the spools are NOT wound correctly causing print failures--the filament will catch on the spool and cause a feed stoppage. Printer keeps on going (Creality Ender 3 - great printer) and filament doesn't feed causing a failed print. Happened on all 3 of my first prints with this filament. I will be sending back as defective. See pic attached.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: No more Hatchbox for me
customer_reviews.text: This filament was OK at first, 2/3 of the way into the spool, I started finding multiple spots where the filament crossed each other. My printer would pause and beep at me to change the filament, which is extremely annoying if i'm running overnight; however, the filament also became very brittle and would snap in multiple locations along the PTFE tube I have it running through between my dry box and printer. I would not buy this again. I've had great luck with eSun and 3DSolutech.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Taha

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to 3D printing be aware that PLA as well as other material will absorb moisture out the the air. This will cause the material to not give you a good strong print. When that happens you will need to put the material in an air tight container and add dessicant to remove the moisture from the material.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filament because of the reviews that it has gotten, and maybe I have gotten a lemon, but I have not had a good experience with this filament. I printed at the recommended setting but consistently run into issues. my prints always warp, the surface of my prints are also rough when they are supposed to be smooth, and the supports and skirts are hard to remove and sometimes get stuck to my prints. I have tried a few other filaments but I have never had problems as I have had with hatchbox.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan lee

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable and consistent
customer_reviews.text: This started great, but after going g through 10, 15 the line keep breaking. The material is not dispurced equally. There are some hard part. There are many 5cm patches of hard, not flexible line which breaks before it is pushed in to the pipe. Be ready to see yor 5 hour job is completed half done with filament cut.
customer_reviews.author: Soheil A.

customer_reviews.title: Spool Stuck on Snapmaker; Old filament Broke Inside Nozzle
customer_reviews.text: I had old filament break in the tube because it was brittle...not a huge deal to prevent (always take the filament out between long breaks in printing), but I had to disassemble my printer/nozzle etc which took some time to clear the piece of broken filament stuck in my nozzle. Also, if you look closely at the photo, you can see the center, where the filament sits, has openings. The got caught on my Snapmaker while feeding an 8 hr print which ruined it and I found my spool on the ground the next day (freaky, I know). This problem is probably unique to a Snapmaker...and is easily remedied by covering the openings with tape, but still an inconvenience nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Yahoo

customer_reviews.title: Needed lots of tweaking on this roll.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what happened here. Half way through the reel and this filament starts to warp on the third layer. Restarted the print several times. Repeated warping while I tweaked and adjusted.Finally settled down at 205c and 35c on the bed. I also saw balling I never saw before. I have never had a problem printing the PLA at 210 and 60c on the bed so this is new. Anyone seen quality issues with Hatchbox lately? Edit: I just noticed that I was sent “true black”. I ordered black and I’m pretty sure there is a difference.
customer_reviews.author: TV GUY

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer filament for beginners
customer_reviews.text: hatchbox PLA filament is not the cheapest filament I have bought in the one year that I have been 3dprinting but it is the best i have found when learning how to use my ender3 printer. it is very forgiving over other brands and types of filaments. I would very much suggest getting at least one roll of PLA to learn on before buying any other types or brands if you are going on the lower end of 3Dprinters.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: PLA NOT SPOOLED CORRECTLY.
customer_reviews.text: Not on spool correctly. 2 hours into a print today (9/19/2019) the PLA was crisscrossed so badly that it was snapped by my printer. The PLA is so tight I had a problem getting the end out. I had to babysit my previous two prints and thought the Pla was coming out ok and was not in the room when the last problem occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S Kleitches

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Hatchbox
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Hatchbox filament because I've never had issues with it. That said I found that black was bad for small prints as all the detail is impossible to see until you start painting it. It has it's uses but not recommended where you need to see the fine detail before applying paint.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcore

customer_reviews.title: Flashforge
customer_reviews.text: I love flashforge because for the price point, this is one of the best options. Never had any tangles with this spool, but I feel like the black filament always has issues. It's either requiring a higher temp than the other pla filaments by hatchbox, or it adheres to the bed to well(even with bed temp adjustments). Basically the black filament is way more finicky than the white or red I've tried in pla. Biggest complaint is that if you plan to sand or end up needing to trim/sand/fix any part of it, the black sheen wears down. Making it extremely noticeable and will need to be painted afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing compared to other products
customer_reviews.text: The good: never had a kink in the spool like how some other have described, filament came off the reel smoothly The bad: before this filament using 3D Solutechs products and overtre products I have never gotten a clog in my nozzle, especially multiple times. At first I thought this had something to do with temperature but this didn’t solve the issue either. Seems like the tolerance of the size of the plastic is not that good, and had weird feeding issues going into the hot end. This filament isn’t as black as 3D solutechs either, it’s closer to a grey. I’m not sure why this filament is more expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Big Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is +/- 0.05, not 0.03
customer_reviews.text: After using this spool for a while and being surprised at how inconsistent the layers would be (some would be too fat and others too thin) I noticed another review that pointed out the accuracy printed in the spool (+/- 0.05) is not what is listed on the box or in the listing (+/- 0.03mm). It's a big difference and the only thing I can think of that would be causing such inconsistent layers.
customer_reviews.author: Mishka Haznor

customer_reviews.title: Decent prints but snagged many times
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is OK. its a very glossy black so it really shows imperfections. It was also very prone to warping on my bed more than other filaments. Knocked off 2 stars because the filament frequently got snagged on itself or on the spool and caused alot of jitter/strain on the extruder to pull it through. Thankfully it didn't appear to affect the print but beware of this. If it snagged more than the extruder could pull you could completely ruin a print.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two separate spools, both jammed
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased the grey hatchbox filament and had no issue with that. Decided to try out their black and was extremely disappointed. First spool kept jamming on multiple print attempts. Reached out to amazon who sent out a replacement. Well, the replacement they sent did the same exact print on the very first try (10+ hours into a 17.5hr print). I tried changing flow rate, temps, etc but irregardless it still jammed. Going to return for a refund and stick with grey for now since I had no issues with my previous spool.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo & Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Filament was wound underneath itself, causing the print to fail
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I have a camera to watch my print, but I was still too late. The filament was spooled incorrectly and wound underneath itself, which caused it to get stuck and therefore skip a layer in my print, which I'll now have to start over. It may not be entirely clear that's what's going on in my picture. (In the photo, there is a lot of unwound PLA as well, which was done on purpose just to avoid that issue at least for the remainder of the print.) This has happened with more than one roll I've received from Hatchbox.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good quality only takes a bit of calibration and a couple ruined prints
customer_reviews.text: Using Ender 3: Nozzle Temp: 210c Bed Temp: 60c Step Speed: 50 mm/s Retraction: 5 mm Leveling: Make sure that when leveling that you space the nozzle to where it drags a bit against the nozzle. The PLA needs to Squish to the bed. My first filament was the Overture PETG black filament, which included a lot of recommended settings from the company in the post. the settings worked as they stated. This spool didn't include any settings except for the nozzle temp, which after a bunch of trial and error I hope my review helps some people. The prints look great and i'll continue using and purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Tia n Jer

customer_reviews.title: My preferred filament
customer_reviews.text: This stuff prints great, the diameter is consistent, and It's also very resistant to humidity. With the heat waves this summer, and huge rains in the spring in the US, i was sure I ruined a roll by leaving it exposed in my garage. But no, it was un-phased. Still prints great. Like the title says, Hatchbox is my filament of choice.
customer_reviews.author: B$

customer_reviews.title: Filament it wound badly gets tangled
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine filament, however it is spooled/wound so badly on the spool that it gets targeted always. You have to babysit the printing to make sure it comes off the spool fine. It sucks to wake up in the morning and find the filament snapped from the extruder having to pull so hard. When I first opened the box it was a mess and looked like a child wound the filament on.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Actual plastic quality is good. Adhesion was not so good. Doesn’t live up to hype.
customer_reviews.text: Decent filament. Didn’t live up to the hype for me at all. Had plenty of issues with it. Especially with adhesion and stringing I didn’t with other brands. even with optimizing heat levels it didn’t get rid of the adhesion issues. Actual quality of the product is good but whatever is used to make it differently does not want to stick to my Ender 3 bed. I rub with alcohol and spray adhesion on before every print and only this brand struggled to still stick.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Very Brittle!
customer_reviews.text: Half way through the reel, the filament started to disintegrate. Filament was used immediately after opening package to mass produce items for first responders. Objects that successfully printed were of decent quality. Used this product in the past with no problems. So just asked to replace with another color. Will give HB another try!
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Seems cheap
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is decent for the price. It’s shiny and has a non-pungent smell. However, it constantly detaches from the bed. It’s also hygroscopic so after a few weeks you’ll need to dry it or else expect some really low quality prints. To be honest, I’ve never been able to achieve very high quality with this stuff, and I’ve have a much better experience printing with PETG and ABS. I use this stuff for prototyping since it’s more biodegradable than aforementioned plastics, but it’s near the same price, so I can’t strongly recommend it. Next time I will try a different brand
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Filament for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: When shopping online I found this HATCHBOX PLA 3D Printer Filament in Black for my Creality Ender 3 Pro 3D printer for a few projects I was creating. The filament arrived quickly in a sealed plastic bag with an anti-moisture packet within. The color was true to the photos online and allowed for a close match to the color of the item I printed. The filament printed evenly throughout the entire printing process and never lost the adhesion to the heated base. I recommend this product for your 3D printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: J & Z Family

customer_reviews.title: This is my default filament for every-day printing.
customer_reviews.text: What's to say? Once you dial in your print settings, this is a great combination of quality and price. Through two spools of black (and one of green) I've had no tangles, moisture, clogs, cracking, or other filament-related issues. On my Ender 3 with a Creality glass bed (with the black textured material on top), 200/55 ̊C with 205/60 ̊C on the first layer works really very nicely for adhesion and dimensional accuracy. Will be buying more as soon as I need some!
customer_reviews.author: J. Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: Attended prints only: a moron spooled the filament
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple rolls of the filament, and it works great...when it comes off the spool. It is a rat's nest on the spool. The cold end cannot pull the filament because it gets bound up like Christmas lights left in the box for a year. It is really hard to even physically unwind the filament in several spots. If you are sitting nearby for the entire print, then use it. You can hear it physically starting to bind up before the cold end quits trying. However, if you plan on taking more than a five minute break, then do not - your print will be ruined.
customer_reviews.author: smallbizwiz

customer_reviews.title: Prints great for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is good but it does have slightly more gloss than I like. This material is a bit stiffer than my last batch of pla2 also but not to bad. I noticed the bed needs to be perfectly clean free from fingerprints or this will not stick well. The texture of my print bed will not show any finger prints so after fighting with settings and nothing working, a simple cleaning with simple green did the trick. Over all a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewDude

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with this brand, and despite every set of settings I've tried, this stuff clogs my printer and snaps off every time. Thought it must have been me at first, but this does not happen with any other brand I've tried with the same print settings. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Roll badly coiled - Ruins prints
customer_reviews.text: Unlike previous versions, the two rolls I got In late April 2020 were badly coiled and the print ruined because the printer was unable to pull the filament neatly / properly. Lost two days worth of printing ! Attaching two pictures showing good coil (previous version - bought in Dec 2019) vs the latest version bought in Apr 2020.
customer_reviews.author: A buyer

customer_reviews.title: Normally Great......
customer_reviews.text: Normally this comes and it is great, I have bought many many spools from Hatchbox. This last time it came in its normal box but no shrink wrap (so it was exposed to air) and the coil was not secured so the filament was partially unspooled which can cause jamming. If this is a company packaging change I wont be purchasing anymore, if this is a one time error then its fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Schaidle

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Black PLA
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time using Hatchbox Black PLA and I am impressed with the quality and ease of use. It printed perfectly out of the box with hardly any stringing. The first retraction test I printed was the only test I needed to print. I printed an Ender 5 Control Back Panel that also came out almost perfect (tiny bit of stringing). I received the PLA in the white and green official box with the stated 3% tolerance printed on the spool.
customer_reviews.author: KarpeTech

customer_reviews.title: Brittle and breaking constantly
customer_reviews.text: What little bit I could get to print printed good but that was very little. Every 2 or 3 feet it would break. After careful inspection there would be a few inches every couple of feet that was extremely brittle and would break with the slightest movement. Then a few more feet of normal flexible material. The white was not like this only the black. Worthless!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Prints well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this spool of PLA after hearing good reviews, and have had good luck with it. The material prints smooth with no significant issues. Running 210C first layer, 205C subsequent layers. EDIT: Third spool is on order, as I near the end of my second spool that still has yet to let me down.
customer_reviews.author: BFeely

customer_reviews.title: Prints well. Consistently arrived late.
customer_reviews.text: Hatchbox makes a good product to be sure, but I had to switch my primary filament to something else.I cant keep my customers waiting just because its difficult to predict when the filament will actually arrive. (I am a prime customer.)
customer_reviews.author: MechEngineerMike

customer_reviews.title: I only buy Hatchbox
customer_reviews.text: I'm a QC Manager and it is my personal opinion that the Hatchbox PLA is among the best on the market for the price bracket. $20 and you can just start creating as long as your printer is dialed in correctly. I've only used white and black so far but they've both been great.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: too brittle to print
customer_reviews.text: Used to be a good brand. But lately it gets so brittle so quickly that it a waste of money. I just had to chuck half a roll because it was so brittle it couldn't even be loaded without breaking. I have three other rolls that are at least as old if not older from other brands and none of them snap when I bend the filament. I was going to build a dry box but I live in a dry climate and so far Hatchbox seems to be the only filament I've ever used that turns to junk just sitting around for a couple weeks. Easier and cheaper to just not by Hatchbox.
customer_reviews.author: Random name

customer_reviews.title: A great choice.
customer_reviews.text: Hatchbox is now my favorite filament. Zero problems with sticking and the print quality is super. Just has a great feel. Make sure you set the temps on your printer to hatchbox recommendations- once I did that, no stringing. Hopefully they’ll get back up and running soon!
customer_reviews.author: Ireviewedit

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain
customer_reviews.text: Bought a spool of this almost two years ago when I first started printing and it has been the most reliable filament I've had. Because it competes with other filaments for usage, I have about a quarter of the spool left; I have kept it in a gallon bag with a pack of silica gels, so there has been next to no reduction in flexibility. While reliability is important to me, I also recommend it for its beauty; the silkiness it takes on (in some prints more than others) is almost hypnotic. Will not hesitate to buy this filament again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DrawSomething

customer_reviews.title: Prints great when it works
customer_reviews.text: Hatchbox is my go-to brand but I have been getting a lot of bad batches lately. I ordered 2 rolls. One roll was fine and worked great, the other roll was not set on the spool very well. I had several prints ruined as it would get caught up in itself and then I would get underextrusion in several spots which compromised the structural stability of the overall print.
customer_reviews.author: Turd Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Only brand I'll buy
customer_reviews.text: Prints without issue. Only issues I've had with anything from Hatchbox is the PETG, and I don't blame Hatchbox for the issues as it is just the properties of that type of material. Only other brand I have tried is the Bibo brand that came with my printer and I haven't had any issues with it either, but I'll stick with Hatchbox as they are a trusted brand and I have no reason to try any other brand at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I started using it and it was ok at first then the filament was breaking on the roll and the prints would fail I stopped using it after it happened 5 times and the roll is still probably 3/4 full
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ballard

customer_reviews.title: So far it's been perfect
customer_reviews.text: We have two Prusa MK3s, and have been through 10 or so spools printing masks in the past month or so. Not a single breakage, clog, or anything. Just press print, wait a couple of hours, and start a new one. We've used black, red, and grey with no issues in any of them. Black pretty well perfectly matches an AR lower if that's your thing. I don't know how durable it would be, but for test printing before moving to ABS or nylon it works well. Free men don't ask.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was better. Printed a temperature tower and see for your self. Same settings and this was on a prusa mini. Dunno if its a bad batch or what but that's crap. Tried printing other things and they look like crap. Sunlu prints way better.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly

customer_reviews.title: Good PLA
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty inexperienced with 3 printing. I just got my machine and the Benchy in the picture is only my second (successful) print. It looks perfectly fine to me now that I've figured out my own user-error problems. I dont know enough to know if this is not a good pla but it certainly worked well enough for my purposes as I'm just learning. One thing to note, others have said in thier reviews about getting the wrong tolerance. Mine was the one stated in the listing (+/- 0.03)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: LatchBox
customer_reviews.text: I've used dozens of spools of filament from many manufacturers, including Hatchbox. I've never had a snag...until now. There were least TWO on a single roll (I gave up after the second one}. Ruined a large print near the end and fouled the extruder. This will be my last box of Hatchbox.
customer_reviews.author: Haxster

customer_reviews.title: poorly wound spool
customer_reviews.text: Half way through the spool, the line crossed under itself, and even snapped at the spool. At least it prints well when it's not kinked, but you have to babysit your printer. Update: just had a failed print that snapped at the spool, in the runout sensor, and even in the bowden tube. Just threw away half a spool of filament.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Love all my Hatchbox filament!
customer_reviews.text: This filament prints super nicely for me across a broad range of temperatures. I print a temperature tower with each new type of filament I buy. I was surprised that my Hatchbox filament printed well across the entire range of tower temps from 180 to 220 deg. c. Amazed at the things I print with no stringing! I would buy more but currently it is unavailable in most colors. It MUST be popular!
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Good first (and any time) filament
customer_reviews.text: I got an Ender 3 Christmas before last, and was given this filament to go with it starting out. I have no complaints, it just works, and works well. Started out with the stock Ender 3 bed and then moved to a piece of plain glass, and it has stuck to both with no problems. When I started running low, I went ahead and purchased another roll. Give it a shot, I don't think you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob.  Just Bob.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what is wrong with this particular roll!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had many spools of Hatchbox filament and they have been wonderful. I re-ordered a roll of Black and it keeps snapping off in my feed path. I replaced the nozzle, did cold pulls with nylon to get any residual bits that may be backing up the feed path, but this particular roll just seems defective. I can print other rolls fine. I like the brand, I just think I got a bad batch or something. I am giving them 2 stars because usually they are good. I am reaching out to them to see what can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filament for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: I tried their white filament first, which was a huge disappointment, after getting great recommendations from others in the 3D printing community about their filament. So, I was skeptical about trying any more of theirs, but I had already ordered this spool and had it sitting in wait. I was not disappointed at all with this spool. The prints were just beautiful. The first layer experience was something that was made of dreams. I just couldn't believe how opposite this was from the white. The quality of the prints were great.
customer_reviews.author: CJCR

customer_reviews.title: No problems, just printing
customer_reviews.text: I have been printing face shields to help local hospitals with the Covid-19 pandemic and have been going through a lot of material. Some materials are prone to stringing, some to being quite finicky. This stuff has been absolutely solid. I printed straight through 3 KG of the Hatchbox true black on my Prusa MK3S. Not one failed print, not one issue with adhesion, not one stringy print or spaghetti monster. Printing at 210 C with a 60C bed this stuff has allowed me to print through at maximum rate without needing to stop and debug print issues. Will definitely be buying more for personal prints after the pandemic is over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New roll but had moisture
customer_reviews.text: I just opened a new box of black filiment I just bought 2 weeks ago, and when I started printing I kept hearing popping noises coming from my hot end, it was also causing blobs on my print due to the popping of the filliment... Very disappointing, since I usually love hatchbox filament.
customer_reviews.author: DarkDestiny

customer_reviews.title: Junk material, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: It seems the quality of the material has gotten much worse over the past few years. I started using Hatchbox PLA material about 4 years ago and it was a premium material, but now its junk. The spool is wound so poorly the material is twisted on itself and the print quality you get now is poor compared to before. DO NOT BUY THIS MATERIAL, IT IS NOT WORTH THE COST SAVINGS!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Grude

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality and consistency. Making a shoddy printer good.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought quite a few rolls of Hatchbox PLA and still have not found any issues even after leaving a roll exposed for three months in the 90 degree heats. It comes vacuum packed and stored inside a cardboard box with info on it. The quality of their dimensional accuracy is wonderful as I've not had a single clog or feeding issue in my printer while using this filament. The filament also has a great shine and gloss to it after it prints.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to the home 3D printing world and have never had to buy my own filament before. This was my first purchase and it’s been a solid choice, I believe. I don’t think any issues in my printing have been from this filament and the color is spot-on (I ordered black). It was shipped sealed and with desiccant to maintain dryness, and in a very nice cardboard box. I will definitely be ordering more colors and restocking this when I’m low!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: My first roll of PLA
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to 3D printing. During this corona madness. Amazon had delayed all non-essential shipments. Luckily this brand is still offering 2 days shipping. So I was left with not many choices. Anyway, the results was satisfactory! I have since printed countless parts that I have designed and downloaded from the web. I was able to do 120ms. Which is pretty decent speed for my ended 3
customer_reviews.author: Hollandking

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Black Filament
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first 3d printer on Black Friday and I needed some filament to go with it. One of filaments I selected was the Hatchbox Black PLA. This filament has given me outstanding and trouble-free prints from the beginning. It was the very first filament I tried and my first print was flawless. Since them I have used this to print a number of objects and, except for my own screw-ups, all my printouts have been more or less perfect. Fair price for an outstanding product. I will buy more of this.
customer_reviews.author: Borgkube

customer_reviews.title: Prints easily, good value PLA
customer_reviews.text: This was my first foray into 3D printing and PLA material. It's also been my best performer, so far. I've not tested any premium grades, but I can say that Hatchbox printed cleanly and at a lower temperature than my other filaments. I had nearly no stringing at all with this. There are cheaper products out there, but I'm happy to order more, should I need it. This stuff just worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: I GOT PETG LABELED AS PLA
customer_reviews.text: HOW?! just got a freah roll and its definitely petg. If you get a roll and it clogs and acts weird trying printng at about 230-245c i can 100% say this is the first amd last time i buy from hatchbox. Back to zyltech i go. Ill happily wait a few days for shipping.. Box and spool both clearly labeled as pla. But everything about the print itself says its petg. With that being said.. Once i went with the idea it was petg and i adjusted accordingly BOOM really nice prints *facepalm* if they cant even label filament right im scared to see what else they arent doing right.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler braun

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what’s wrong with it, but it is awful.
customer_reviews.text: I have used hatchbox PLA exclusively since I got my ender 3. This roll was complete garbage. EVERY print had problems, not sure why, I got this rather than the grey I normally get as it was out of stock. Needless to say, I’m switching back to the grey. Hope this was a one off...
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kotz

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional as Always
customer_reviews.text: My third spool of Hatchbox PLA (this one black, previously white and blue), and I continue to be very happy with it. Yeah, I've had problem prints, but it's usually bed level, temperature, or some other thing I did, not the Hatchbox PLA. Even with my ineptitude, this filament performs well. End product is good too (w/ Ender 3). I will continue to buy Hatchbox. Actually, I've never bought any other brand of PLA.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kunde

customer_reviews.title: May be awesome generally but not for my MakerBot Replicator 5th Gen.
customer_reviews.text: Got a few great prints out of it... until I noticed that something about the filament had completely gunked up my Smart Extruder+. Completely. The heating assembly all around the extruder tip was *coated*, 1-2mm in places, causing it to mis-heat and fail. Fortunately, I was able to sand it off the extruder with my Dremel to get it working properly again. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to for quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been printing since February and i have ordered a lot of rolls of filament. This is by far the best for the black that i have found. It prints nice, its really durable and consistent prints. I highly recommend this to everyone I think i am on my 3rd roll. Only real downside is you lose quality on prints when you use black because its hard to see because of the color and not the filament. In that case order from hatchbox and go with a different color. GREAT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Knurl

customer_reviews.title: Good PLA good value
customer_reviews.text: This is great PLA, it's dimensional accuracy is great within +/- .02. Basically no odor, prints details well and it's spooled very well. I print at 210 with my bed set to 60 and have basically no adhesion problems.
customer_reviews.author: CHWcosplay

customer_reviews.title: Filament is great.  The way it is shipped, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Hatchbox PLA filament. To me it outperforms most other PLA. The problem I have is with shipping. It was shipped in the filament box with a label on it. No tape or anything keeping the box closed. I had to re-order because 1 that I ordered was lost in the mail. It was probably lost because the filament fell out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mouton

product_meta.title: HATCHBOX PLA 3D Printer Filament, Dimensional Accuracy +/- 0.03 mm, 1 kg Spool, 1.75 mm, Black, Pack of 1
feature_bullets: PLA (Polylactic Acid) 3D Printer Filament Vacuumed Sealed With Desiccant
Spool Diameter: 7.88" - Spool Width: 2.69" - Spool Hub Hole Diameter: 2.20"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
